page.title: 17 Farming
page.content: Linlithgow lies in a valley between the bathgate hills and the lower Bo'ness hills.The land is fairly flat around Linlithgow,but further south, the land is hilly.Hillhouse Farm is situated on the side of a hill,which is why the land there is used for grazing.The landscape is dotted with patches of deciduous woodland. There are several farms around Linlithgow,which are Riccarton,Park Farm,Hillhouse,Parkly Craigs,Parkly Place,Kingsfield and Boghall.Boghall is an experimental farm,while the rest are all normal.The main crops grown around here are barley ,turnips, hay,wheat and oil seed rape.Hillhouse farm has mostly grazing land.Farmers rent land from the farmer,Mr.West for cattle.The main kinds of animals in the area are beef cattle and dairy cattle.
